summary: Email correspondence between legal counsel regarding the case US v. Noel and Thomas, specifically concerning a letter about surveillance video that has been designated as Protected Materials under a Protective Order. The email includes an attachment of the government's response.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: Named defendant in the case US v. Noel and Thomas, referenced in the subject line of the correspondence.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: Named defendant in the case US v. Noel and Thomas, referenced in the subject line of the correspondence.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sent the original email on January 24, 2020, attaching correspondence about surveillance video designated as Protected Materials.

connections.description: Both are named defendants in the same criminal case (US v. Noel and Thomas), indicating they are being prosecuted together.
The prosecutor is handling the case against defendant Noel, as indicated in the correspondence subject.
The prosecutor is handling the case against defendant Thomas, as indicated in the correspondence subject.

events.title: Government Letter Regarding Surveillance Video
events.description: The Assistant United States Attorney sent correspondence about surveillance video in the case US v. Noel and Thomas, designating it as Protected Materials under a Protective Order.

events.title: Forwarding of Government Response
events.description: Legal counsel forwarded the government's response letter regarding surveillance video to other counsel.

keyFacts: The document is email correspondence regarding the criminal case US v. Noel and Thomas.
The subject involves a letter about surveillance video that has been designated as Protected Materials under a Protective Order.
The correspondence includes an attachment titled 'Response_to_I-24-20Jetter_from_the_Government.pdf'.
The email was sent from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York.
The communication demonstrates legal procedures regarding protected materials in an ongoing prosecution.
